alert.note: Alert for Dyer; Lake; Obion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 15 at 10:25PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Pemiscot, western Dyer, southwestern Obion and southern Lake Counties through 1100 PM CST... At 1025 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Heloise, or 10 miles south of Caruthersville, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Caruthersville, Hayti, Ridgely, Cooter, Heloise, Miston, Cloverdale, Cottonwood Grove, Lenox, Ayers, Cat Corner, Hathaway, Broadmoor, Madie, Lane, Bogota, Tennemo, Boothspoint, Big Boy Junction and Millsfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CST for eastern Arkansas...southeastern Missouri...and west Tennessee.
